alert.note: Alert for Western Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 10 at 3:18AM EST until December 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 7 PM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Western Windham County. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult due to snow covered roadways and low visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute on Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain will change to a heavy, wet snow late tonight and continue through Monday afternoon. The weight of the snow could lead to downed trees and power lines resulting in some power outages. The higher amounts will occur at elevations above 1500 feet.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
